thread.title: Low enrollment leads to Indianapolis charter school's closure
thread.title_full: Low enrollment leads to Indianapolis charter school's closure

title: Low enrollment leads to Indianapolis charter school's closure

organizations.name: indiana math and science academy west
indiana math and science academy north
indiana math and science academy south

text:
Low enrollment leads to Indianapolis charter school's closure Vic Ryckaert , vic.ryckaert@indystar.com Published 11:43 a.m. ET Feb. 7, 2017 | Updated 13 hours ago Buy Photo A teacher writes algebraic equations on a classroom chalkboard. /Charlie Nye / The Star 2003 file photo (Photo: Charlie Nye, Charlie Nye) Buy Photo 
The Indiana Math and Science Academy will close its south-side location at the end of the school year, the charter's parent company announced. 
"We have fallen short of our goal to maintain enrollment at a financially viable level that allows us to provide the high-quality education that our students deserve," Concept Schools spokesman Christopher Murphy said in a statement. 
The lagging enrollment prompted the charter school's board voted Jan. 21 to close Indiana Math and Science Academy South, 2710 Bethel Ave., on June 30. 
Parents, teachers and staff were notified Monday. 
Indiana Math and Science Academy North and Indiana Math and Science Academy West will remain open. 
Call IndyStar reporter Vic Ryckaert at (317) 444-2701. Follow him on Twitter: @vicryc .
